semantic_identifier: 164: feat: Backend: add Simple Mode default config + onboarding state for core Sales_Accelerator workflows

sections.text:
## Description

Implements the backend/default-config and state management needed for a new “Simple Mode” onboarding path.

What this PR does
- Adds a new “Simple Mode” preset that preselects a minimal recommended bundle of alerts, templates, and models for small teams.
- Ensures first-run defaults auto-enable only core Sales_Accelerator workflows:
  - Forecasting
  - Next-best-action
  - Risk alerts
- Wires these workflows to Customer_Analyzer fit/positioning inputs by default (no manual tuning required).
- Introduces persisted onboarding state to track selected mode (Simple vs Advanced) and supports switching to “Advanced” later without blocking existing customers.

Implementation notes (high level)
- Default configuration
  - Adds a versioned default-config preset (Simple) with explicit allowlists for enabled workflows/alerts/templates/models.
  - Applies the preset only when initializing a new tenant/workspace or when no prior config exists.
  - Leaves existing tenant configurations untouched (no retroactive changes).
- State management
  - Adds an onboarding mode flag in persisted workspace/tenant settings.
  - Provides service-layer helpers to (a) initialize with Simple defaults and (b) transition to Advanced mode by lifting restrictions/allowlists while retaining current enabled items.
- Safety/guardrails
  - Prevents non-core workflows from being enabled by default under Simple Mode.
  - Adds config validation to ensure required Customer_Analyzer inputs are present for the core workflows.

User impact
- New workspaces will start in Simple Mode with a minimal, working set of core workflows enabled out of the box.
- UI surfacing/progressive disclosure is not included here; this PR only provides the backend defaults and persisted mode/state needed for upcoming UI work.

Testing
- Adds/updates unit tests for default-config generation, first-run initialization behavior, and mode switching semantics.
- Adds regression coverage to ensure existing workspaces do not receive default overwrites.

## How Has This Been Tested?
